dcterms:creator: J. Staal
M. D. Abràmoff
M. Niemeijer
M. A. Viergever
B. Van Ginneken
dcterms:description: The DRIVE dataset is a 2D retinal vessel dataset with 40 images. Each image has a resolution of 584 × 565. We use the dataset’s predetermined split of 20 training images and 20 test images.
dcterms:title: DRIVE

dcterms:creator: Y. Ma
H. Hao
J. Xie
H. Fu
J. Zhang
J. Yang
Z. Wang
J. Liu
Y. Zheng
Y. Zhao
dcterms:description: The ROSE dataset is a 2D retinal OCTA (Optical Coherence Tomography Angiography) segmentation dataset. It has a predetermined split of 30 train and 9 test samples, with each sample having a resolution of 304 × 304.
dcterms:title: ROSE

dcterms:creator: V. Mnih
dcterms:description: The ROADS dataset is a large, non-medical dataset containing 1171 aerial images (1108 train, 14 validation, and 49 test), each of 1500 × 1500 resolution. It is a challenging dataset due to obstruction from nearby trees, shadows, varying texture/color of roads, road class imbalance, and so on.
dcterms:title: ROADS

dcterms:creator: G. Luo
K. Wang
J. Liu
S. Li
X. Liang
X. Li
S. Gan
W. Wang
W. Dong
W. Wang
dcterms:description: The PARSE dataset is a 3D CT dataset containing pulmonary artery segmentations. The dataset contains 100 volumes and their sizes vary from 512 × 512 × 228 to 512 × 512 × 376. As there is no predetermined train/test split, we use 4-fold cross-validation and report the average performance.
dcterms:title: PARSE 2022 Grand Challenge
